<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><a name="SpherixIncorporatedNotesToFinanci_125236"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting
Policies</font></b></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nature of Business</font></i></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January 1,
2006, Spherix Incorporated transferred the assets of its information services
segment (the &#147;InfoSpherix Division&#148;) to a new wholly-owned subsidiary,
InfoSpherix Incorporated (&#147;InfoSpherix&#148;).&#160;
Spherix Incorporated (&#147;Spherix&#148;) was founded in 1967, and both Companies
are incorporated in Delaware.&#160; The
activities of the biotechnology segment (&#147;BioSpherix&#148;) continue to operate through
Spherix Incorporated.&#160; BioSpherix is
dedicated to research, development, and productization of proprietary
products.&#160; InfoSpherix operates contact
center services providing consulting, information management, and materials
management to the public as well as reservation and tourism solutions.&#160; These services are provided primarily under
government contracts.&#160; The Company
maintains three facilities in Maryland, including its corporate headquarters in
Beltsville, and one facility in Indiana.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Basis of Presentation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beginning January
1, 2006, the consolidated financial statements include the accounts of both
Spherix Incorporated and InfoSpherix Incorporated (collectively, the &#147;Company&#148;).&#160; All intercompany balances and transactions
have been eliminated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Use of Estimates and Assumptions</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying
consolidated financial statements have been prepared in conformity with
accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.&#160; This requires management to make estimates
and assumptions that affect certain reported amounts of assets and liabilities
and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the
financial statements, and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during
the period.&#160; Accordingly, actual results
could differ from those estimates and assumptions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash
Equivalents</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
considers all highly liquid investments with original maturities of three
months or less to be cash equivalents.&#160;
At December 31, 2006, the Company had approximately $6.5 million invested
in treasury funds with a maturity of three months or less, which are included
as cash and cash equivalents. The Company maintains cash balances at several
banks. Accounts at each institution are insured by the Federal Deposit
Insurance Corporation up to $100,000. At December 31, 2006, the Company&#146;s cash
and cash equivalent in excess of the FDIC limits was $10,751,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Concentrations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006,
revenue from three major government contracts accounted for 16%, 15%, and 11%
of the Company&#146;s total revenue.&#160; No other
contracts were greater than 10%.&#160; At
December 31, 2006, four major contracts constituted 68% of the trade accounts
receivable, the components of which were 26%, 16%, 15% and 11%.&#160; No other single contract was greater than 10%
of total trade accounts receivable.&#160;
Receivables from Federal and state government agencies represented 83%
of the total trade accounts receivable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005,
revenue from four major government contracts accounted for 17%, 16%, 12%, and
12% of the Company&#146;s total revenue.&#160; No
other contracts were greater than 10%.&#160;
At December 31, 2005, four major contracts constituted 75% of the trade
accounts receivable, the components of which were 30%, 16%, 15% and 14%.&#160; No other single contract was greater than 10%
of total trade accounts receivable.&#160;
Receivables from Federal and state government agencies represented 91%
of the total trade accounts receivable.&#160;
Government contracts accounted for approximately 99%, 100%, and 99% of
the InfoSpherix revenue in 2006, 2005, and 2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Property
and Equipment and Depreciation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and
equipment are stated at cost and consist of office furniture and equipment,
computer hardware and software, leasehold improvements, and capital
leases.&#160; Computer hardware and software
include the cost of internally developed software programs, which have
long-term benefits.&#160; The Company has
developed and continues to develop a large variety of software applications
that are used in the performance of its multiple contact center and park
reservation contracts.&#160; These
applications are designed to aid our telephone operators in providing
information to the public as well as collecting caller information.&#160; The Company has also developed software
applications that we use to </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\92132328404_D11854_1955827\5660-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 13:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">process park reservation
transactions.&#160; The Company capitalizes
the labor and fringe costs incurred by our software programmers in the
development of these applications as well as the costs incurred in creating
functionality enhancements.&#160; In 2006 and
2005, the Company capitalized approximately $790,000 and $804,000 in internally
developed software, respectively.&#160; The
Company computes depreciation and amortization under the straight-line method
and typically over the following estimated useful lives of the related assets:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="365" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:274.0pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading -->Office furniture and
  equipment</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="77" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 10 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="365" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:274.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Computer
  hardware and software</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="77" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.8pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 5 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Leasehold
improvements are depreciated or amortized over the lesser of the term of the
related lease or the estimated useful lives of the assets (generally 5 to 10
years).&#160; Major additions, improvements
and renewals are capitalized and ordinary repairs, maintenance, and renewals
are expensed in the year incurred.&#160; Gains
or losses from the sale or retirement of property and equipment result from the
difference between sales proceeds (if any) and the assets&#146; net book value, and
are recorded in the consolidated Statement of Operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Inventory</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in
prepaid expenses at December 31, 2006, is approximately $65,000 of Naturlose
inventory.&#160; The inventory is valued at
lower of cost or market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Deferred
Rent</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
entered into leases for its Beltsville, Cumberland, Annapolis and Indianapolis
facilities in 1997, 2003, 2004, and 2006, respectively.&#160; The excess of the rent expense over the cash
payments for rent is recorded as deferred rent and is being amortized over the
life of the leases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Research and Development Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Research
and development costs are charged to operations as incurred.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Patent
Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Legal costs
incurred in connection with patent applications and costs of acquiring patents
are capitalized when incurred.&#160; When
patents are granted, costs are amortized over a term representing the lesser of
the life of the patent or the projected sales period of the product or process.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue
Recognition</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue is
recognized using the following methods depending upon the terms of the
contracts:&#160; time and materials or fixed
price.&#160; Revenue under time and materials
contracts is recognized at contractually agreed-upon rates based upon direct
labor hours expended and other direct costs incurred.&#160; Revenue for fixed-price contracts is
recognized using unit-of-delivery methods.&#160;
Losses, if any, on contracts are recorded during the period when first
determined.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Direct
Contract and Operating Costs</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
direct contract and operating costs consist primarily of labor and fringe costs
for contact center personnel, subcontractors, telephone related costs,
depreciation on computer hardware and software and related facilities costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Selling,
General and Administrative Expense</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
selling, general and administrative expenses consist primarily of executive
management salaries and fringes, sales and marketing costs, finance and accounting,
human resources, as well as general corporate costs and costs related to being
a public company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred income
taxes are recognized for the tax consequences in future years of differences
between the tax bases of assets and liabilities and their financial reporting
amounts at each year end, based on enacted tax laws and </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\92132328404_D11854_1955827\5660-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 13:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">statutory tax rates
applicable to the periods in which the differences are expected to affect
taxable income.&#160; A valuation allowance is
established based upon periodic assessments made by management to reduce
deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.&#160; Income tax expense is the tax payable for the
period and the change during the period in deferred tax assets and liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Fair
Value Information</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated fair
value of the Company&#146;s financial instruments, which include cash, receivables,
accounts payable, and bank line of credit reported in the Consolidated Balance
Sheet, approximate their carrying value given their short maturities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January
1, 2006, the Company adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.
123(R) &#147;Share-Based Payment&#148; (FAS 123R), which requires the measurement of all
employee share-based payments to employees, including grants of employee stock
options, using a fair-value based method and the recording of such expense in
the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss. &#160;The Company uses a Black-Scholes option
pricing model and has elected to use the modified prospective transition method
and, therefore, has not restated results for prior periods.&#160; At the time the Company adopted FAS 123R,
there were no unvested options outstanding.&#160;
For the year ended December 31, 2006, the Company realized $24,000 in
stock based compensation expense relating to 59,000 stock options awarded in
February 2006.&#160; The effect of adopting
FAS 123R increased the loss from operations, and decreased the income before
taxes and the net income by $24,000 for the year ended December 31, 2006, and
had no effect on basic and diluted earnings per share, net cash flow from
operations, or net cash flow from financing activities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years
prior to January 1, 2006, the Company elected the &#147;disclosure only&#148;
presentation under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 &#147;Accounting
for Stock Based Compensation&#148; (FAS 123) and, consequently, did not record
compensation expense relating to employee option grants provided the exercise
prices were at or above fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the grant
date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November 4,
2005, the Company had a total of 176,658 previously unvested stock options
outstanding.&#160; The exercise prices of all
of these options were greater than the fair value of the Company&#146;s stock.&#160; On this day, the Board of Directors voted to
fully vest all of the then outstanding stock options.&#160; The average weighted exercise price of these
options was $7.98.&#160; The primary purpose
of the accelerated vesting was to enable the Company to avoid recognizing the
future compensation expense for these options upon adoption of &#147;SFAS 123R.&#148;&#160; The related future stock-based employee
compensation expense that was eliminated as a result of the acceleration of the
vesting of these options is approximately $562,000, and had the effect of
increasing the 2005 proforma loss from $3,110,977 to $3,672,738 and the
proforma loss per share from $(0.26) to $(0.31).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To measure
stock-based compensation in accordance with SFAS 123, the fair value of each
option grant was estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model.&#160; The following
table summarizes the pro-forma net loss and net loss per share resulting from
applying SFAS 123.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table summarizes the pro-forma net loss and net loss per share resulting from
applying FAS 123.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  reported</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.24</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.24</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="62%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:62.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pro
  forma</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.31</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.29</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\92132328404_D11854_1955827\5660-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 13:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Net income (Loss) Per Share</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic net income
(loss) per common share has been computed by dividing net income (loss) by the
weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the year.&#160; Diluted net income per common share is
computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares
outstanding with an assumed increase in common shares outstanding for common
stock equivalents.&#160; At December 31, 2006,
the Company had outstanding 501,100 options, none of which were assumed likely
to be exercised.&#160; Diluted net loss per common
share has been computed by dividing net loss by the weighted-average number of
common shares outstanding without an assumed increase in common shares
outstanding for common stock equivalents, as common stock equivalents are
antidilutive.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">New Accounting Pronouncements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2006, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued FASB Interpretation No.
48, &#147;Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&#148; (&#147;FIN48&#148;).&#160; The Interpretation clarifies the accounting
for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#146;s financial
statements in accordance with FASB Statement No. 109, &#147;Accounting for Income
Taxes.&#148;&#160; We are required to adopt FIN 48
effective January 1, 2007.&#160;&#160; We are
currently evaluating the impact this interpretation will have on our financial
position, results of operations, and cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006,
the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 157, &#147;Fair
Value Measurements&#148; (&#147;SFAS 157&#148;).&#160; SFAS
157 defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair, and expands
disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160;
We are required to adopt SFAS 157 effective January 1, 2008. We do not
expect the adoption of SFAS 157 to have a material affect on our financial
position, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006,
the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) issued Staff Accounting
Bulletin No. 108 (&#147;SAB 108&#148;).&#160; SAB 108
addresses diversity in practice in quantifying financial statement
misstatements and the potential under current practice for the build up of
improper amounts on the balance sheet.&#160;
The bulletin requires companies to quantify misstatements based on the
impact on the financial statements and related disclosures.&#160; We have adopted SAB 108 in connection with
the preparation of our financial statements for the year ended December 31,
2006.&#160; The adoption of SAB 108 did not
have a material impact on our financial position, results of operations or cash
flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Restricted Investments</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31, 2005, the Company held $2,000,000 in
a restricted certificate of deposit as collateral on the Company&#146;s bank line of
credit.&#160; The Company was released from
the bank line of credit restriction when the line of credit matured on March
31, 2006, (see Note 6 &#147;Line of Credit&#148;).&#160;
The certificate of deposit matured on June 30, 2006.&#160; A restricted certificate of deposit is not
required as collateral on the new line of credit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Allowance for Doubtful Accounts</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management
regularly reviews the accounts receivables for uncollectible and potentially
uncollectible accounts and when necessary establishes an allowance for doubtful
accounts.</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="499" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:374.05pt;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter -->Balance, December 31, 2003</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="499" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:374.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Write-off of uncollectible accounts</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(9,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s depreciation expense for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005 and 2004 were $2,434,000, $2,413,000 and
$2,138,000, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Intangible Assets</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 1, 2004,
the Company purchased certain assets of Daksoft, Inc. related to its
reservation business, which operates under the name &#147;ReserveIt.&#148;&#160; The purchase included the acquisition of six
additional government reservation contracts and the intellectual property
rights to the name &#147;ReserveIt,&#148; as well as other assets of the division.&#160; Spherix purchased the assets for $700,000
plus the issuance of 43,029 shares of common stock valued at $288,000 (subject
to certain restrictions).&#160; The Company
assessed the value of the purchased contracts to be $976,000 and will amortize
it annually over seven years, the estimated contractual life.&#160; In 2006, 2005 and 2004, the Company
recognized $139,000, $139,000, and $116,000, respectively, in related
amortization expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
total amortization expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005,
and 2004 were $167,000, $161,000 and $140,000, respectively. The Company&#146;s
future amortization over the next five years based on its intangible assets at
December&nbsp;31, 2006, 2005, and 2004 are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Debt</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Line
of Credit</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the
creation of InfoSpherix as a wholly-owned subsidiary, management no longer
considers maintaining a bank line of credit for the parent company, Spherix,
necessary, and, therefore decided not to renew the old credit agreement when it
matured on March 31, 2006.&#160; The Company
entered into a new agreement on March 31, 2006 with Bank of America (&#147;the Bank&#148;)
to establish a line-of-credit (&#147;New Agreement&#148;) for its subsidiary, InfoSpherix
Incorporated, with the outstanding borrowings of approximately $1.5 million
under the old line of credit transferred to the new agreement.&#160; Management considers the establishment of
this credit facility for the subsidiary necessary to ensure timely cash flow
for the subsidiary&#146;s operations.&#160; The New
Agreement, which matures June 30, 2008, provides for borrowings up to $1.5
million, is collateralized by the subsidiary&#146;s accounts receivables and
equipment, and contains covenants on tangible net worth and funded debt to
EBITDA ratios.&#160; Such covenants could have
a limiting effect on the amount of cash that the subsidiary can advance to
Spherix.&#160; The interest rate under the
Agreement is based on the LIBOR daily floating rate plus 3% (approximately
8.34% at December 31, 2006).&#160; The Company
had no outstanding borrowings under the Agreement at December 31, 2006, and the
total amount available for future advance to the subsidiary was $1.5 million
under the Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Accounts Payable and Accrued Expenses</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounts payable
and accrued expenses consisted of the following at December 31:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="408" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:306.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\92132328404_D11854_1955827\5660-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 13:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Stockholder Equity</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Private Placements</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
determined that, as of June 30, 2005, it was approximately $454,000 short of
meeting NASDAQ&#146;s Global Market listing requirement of maintaining a minimum of
$10,000,000 in shareholders&#146; equity.&#160;
NASDAQ gave the Company until September 1, 2005, to correct this
situation, which the Company achieved through its third quarter results.&#160; However, in anticipation of incurring losses
due to seasonal fluctuations in the InfoSpherix business segment that occur in
the first and fourth quarters of the year, the Company entered into a Standby
Equity Distribution Agreement (&#147;SEDA&#148;) with Cornell Capital Partners, L.P. (&#147;Cornell&#148;)
on July 22, 2005.&#160; Under the SEDA,
Spherix can require Cornell to purchase up to $4,000,000 of the Company&#146;s
common stock over a two-year period following the effective date, October 12,
2005, of the registration covering the shares of our common stock to be sold to
Cornell.&#160; The SEDA establishes what is
sometimes termed an &#147;equity line of credit&#148; or an &#147;equity draw-down facility.&#148;&#160; The $4,000,000 facility may be drawn down
upon by us in installments, the maximum amount of each draw down is limited to
$350,000.&#160; For each share of common stock
purchased under the SEDA, Cornell will pay 95% of the lowest volume weighted
average price (&#147;VWAP&#148;) of the Company&#146;s shares during the five trading days
following the Company&#146;s draw down notice to Cornell.&#160; The VWAP used in the calculation is that
reported by Bloomberg, LLC, a third-party reporting service.&#160; In general, the VWAP represents the sum of
the value of all the sales of our common stock for a given day (the total
shares sold in each trade times the sales price per share of the common stock
for that trade), divided by the total number of our shares sold on that
day.&#160; The Company is also committed to
pay to Cornell an amount equal to 5% of each purchase of common stock made by
Cornell under the SEDA.&#160; Under the terms
of the SEDA agreement, the Company is not obligated to draw down on the SEDA
facility, but once we satisfy normal conditions for this type of transaction,
we have the right to require Cornell to purchase our common stock.&#160; In connection with the SEDA, we have issued
to Cornell 95,000 shares of our common stock and paid a due diligence fee of
$5,000.&#160; We also paid Yorkville Advisors
Management, LLC, the investment manager for Cornell, a structuring fee of
$15,000, and on each sale under the SEDA we will pay an additional structuring
fee of $500.&#160; Newbridge Securities
Corporation acted as our placement agent for the SEDA, and we paid that firm a
fee of 5,000 shares of our common stock valued at $10,000.&#160; We also granted Newbridge Securities
Corporation piggy-back registration rights covering these shares.&#160; Registration of our common shares covered
under the SEDA was completed in October 2005.&#160;
During the term of the SEDA, our Officers and Directors have agreed not
to sell any of their shares of our common stock, except to the extent permitted
under Rule 144.&#160; The number of shares of
our common stock issuable to Cornell under the SEDA is subject to a 9.99% cap
on the beneficial ownership that Cornell and its affiliates may have at the
time of each installment (beneficial ownership is to be calculated in
accordance with Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act).&#160; Further, the Company may not issue more than
19.99% of our currently outstanding shares under the SEDA unless shareholder
approval is received.&#160; Fees paid through
cash and common stock to Cornell, Yorkville Advisors, and Newbridge Security
totaling $220,000 were charged against the proceeds of the initial draw on the
facility.&#160; In 2006, the Company sold
819,453 shares under the SEDA agreement for total proceeds of $1,897,000, and
in 2005, the Company sold 310,076 shares under the SEDA agreement for total
proceeds of $376,000.&#160; At December 31,
2006, the Company&#146;s shareholder&#146;s equity was $14.6 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 9, 2006,
in exchange for the Company&#146;s agreement to reduce the exercise price of 585,973
in outstanding warrants to $2.04 per share, an Investor agreed to exercise the
full 585,973 shares for total proceeds of approximately $1.2 million.&#160; In connection with these warrants, the new
holder of the warrants agreed that it would not exercise any of the warrants to
the extent that it would acquire shares of Common Stock exceeding 9.9% of the
outstanding Common Stock, nor would it knowingly sell shares to anyone to the
extent that their holdings in the Company would exceed 4.9% of the outstanding
Common Stock.&#160; The warrants and shares of
Common Stock were issued in transactions exempt from Registration pursuant to
Section 4(2) of the Securities Act.&#160; The
Company has registered the shares issuable upon exercise of the warrants for
resale by the institutional investor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock
Option Plan</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has an
Employees&#146; Stock Option Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) which permits issuance of both
Incentive Stock Options (ISO) and Non-Qualified Stock Options, whereby options
may be granted to officers and Directors and other key employees to purchase up
to 1,000,000 shares of common stock in amounts determined by the Compensation
Committee of the Board of Directors through December 31, 2007.&#160; During 2006, 2005, and 2004, 59,000, 12,500,
and 60,000 options were granted under the Plan, respectively.&#160; At December 31, 2006, 403,100 options were
available for grant under the Plan.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\92132328404_D11854_1955827\5660-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 13:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November 4,
2005, the Company had a total of 176,658 previously unvested stock options
outstanding.&#160; The exercise prices of all
of these options were greater than the fair value of the Company&#146;s stock.&#160; The Board of Directors approved the
acceleration of vesting of all such outstanding stock options.&#160; The average weighted exercise price of these
options was $7.98.&#160; The primary purpose
of the accelerated vesting was to enable the Company to avoid recognizing the
future compensation expense for these options upon adoption of &#147;SFAS 123R.&#148;&#160; The estimated stock-based employee
compensation expense that was eliminated as a result of this action was
approximately $562,000, and had the effect of increasing the 2005 proforma loss
from $3,110,977 to $3,672,738 and the proforma loss per share from $(0.24) to
$(0.31).</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company used
the following assumptions in the Black-Scholes calculation used to measure the
fair value of stock-based compensation in accordance with SFAS 123R.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="413" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:309.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dividend yield</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="31" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:23.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="31" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:23.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Income Taxes</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income tax expense
for 2006 was $105,000 and is attributed to the alternative minimum tax.&#160; There was no income tax expense for the years
2005 and 2004 as a result of net losses and the net operating loss
carryforwards and increases in the valuation allowance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The tax effect of
significant temporary differences representing deferred tax assets as of
December 31, 2006 and 2005, is as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately $4.1
million in U.S. tax net operating losses were utilized in 2006.&#160; The Company has $14.6 million in net
operating loss carryforwards that will be available to offset regular taxable
U.S. income during the carryforward period, which will expire from 2019 through
2025.&#160; Based on the Company&#146;s historical
losses and its accumulated deficit, the Company has provided a full valuation
allowance against the net deferred tax asset.&#160;
</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\9210144703_D11529_1954770\5660-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 10:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31, 2006,
approximately $388,000 of the valuation allowance, related to benefits from
stock compensation, will be credited to &#147;paid in capital&#148; when recognized in
future periods. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reconciliation
between actual tax expenses and taxes computed at the statutory Federal rate of
34 percent for 2006, 2005, and 2004 are as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(22,727</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="64%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:64.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Commitments and Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Government
Contracts</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The principal
portion of the Company&#146;s revenue has been generated under government contracts,
by InfoSpherix.&#160; These contracts are
awarded pursuant to a competitive bidding process.&#160; As of December 31, 2006, none of the Company&#146;s
contracts were under protest.&#160; The
Government has the right to audit billings and Spherix does not expect
adjustments to such billings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Leases</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has
various commitments under capital and operating leases through 2011 relating to
office equipment, its call center facility in Cumberland, Maryland, its call
center facility in Carmel, Indiana, its call center and administrative offices in
Beltsville, Maryland, and its research lab and administrative office in
Annapolis, Maryland.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future
minimum rentals as of December 31, 2006, under noncancellable leases are as
follows:</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Some of the
Company&#146;s building leases contain step rent provisions, capital improvement
funding, or other tenant allowances.&#160;
Minimum rental payments including allowances on such leases is
recognized on a straight-line basis over the term of the leases.&#160; The Company incurred rental expenses of
$1,343,000, $942,000, and $860,000, under operating leases for years 2006,
2005, and 2004, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\9210144703_D11529_1954770\5660-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 10:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Related
Party Transactions</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employment, Deferred
Compensation, and Consulting Agreements for Principal Stockholders</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dr. Gilbert V.
Levin, Company founder and former CEO, has served under an Employment Agreement
since March 3, 1969.&#160; This Agreement was
amended and restated in 2004, and continued through December 31, 2004.&#160; On February 17, 1993, the Company entered into
agreements with Dr. Levin and Mrs. M. Karen Levin to provide adequate retirement
benefits and to protect the Company&#146;s stock from a precipitous sale to pay
estate taxes upon their deaths.&#160; These
agreements provided that, upon retirement, under a Supplemental Executive
Retirement Plan (SERP), these individuals would receive deferred compensation
equal to 70% and 60%, respectively, of their average annual total compensation
less the assumed returns from investment of their funded pension plans, and
less their social security payments.&#160; On
March 23, 2004, after lengthy consideration and consultation, the Board and the
Levins approved new deferred compensation agreements.&#160; At March 23, 2004, the deferred compensation
plan for Dr. Levin was unfunded and the Company had no liability under the
plan.&#160; In the March 23, 2004 agreement,
Dr. Levin voluntarily forgave the Company of its obligations under his SERP
agreement.&#160; The Company also has agreed
to provide Dr. Levin with lifetime payments of $12,500 each quarter and to fund
long-term lifetime healthcare and health insurance policies following his full
retirement from the Company.&#160; In 2004,
Dr. and Mrs. Levin voluntarily forgave the Company its obligation to retain key
man life insurance on them and to buy back stock from the last to survive.&#160; On November 29, 2005, the Board and Mrs.
Levin approved a new agreement concerning her retirement benefits in connection
with her January 4, 2006 retirement from the Company.&#160; At November 29, 2005, the deferred
compensation plan for Mrs. Levin was unfunded and the Company had no liability
under the plan as actuarially determined.&#160;
In the November 29, 2005 agreement, Mrs. Levin voluntarily forgave the
Company its obligations under her SERP agreement.&#160; The Company also has agreed to provide Mrs.
Levin lifetime payments of $12,500 each quarter and to fund long-term lifetime
healthcare and health insurance policies following her January 4, 2006,
retirement from the Company.&#160; At December
31, 2006, the Company&#146;s liability for both Dr. Levin and Mrs. Levin was
estimated to be $389,000 for the lifetime payments and $156,000 for funding the
long-term lifetime healthcare and health insurance policies.&#160; The non-current portion of these amounts is
reported on the accompanying balance sheet as deferred compensation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon completion of
their employment, the officer-stockholders agree to serve as consultants to the
Company on an as-needed basis, at a specified daily rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2005,
Spherix filed an official protest of the U.S. Department of Agriculture&#146;s award
of the National Recreation Reservation System (&#147;NRRS&#148;) contract to
ReserveAmerica, a TicketMaster subsidiary.&#160;
The NRRS will provide reservation services for all Federal recreation
facilities, including the National Park sites serviced by Spherix under its
National Park Reservation Service (&#147;NPRS&#148;) contract with the Department of
Interior.&#160; On October 20, 2005, the
Government Accountability Office (&#147;GAO&#148;) sustained Spherix&#146;s challenge to the
USDA Forest Service award and recommended that the Department of Agriculture
reopen the competition and make a new award decision.&#160; This was the second time that GAO found the
Forest Service&#146;s attempt to award the NRRS contract to ReserveAmerica to be
flawed.&#160; In October 2006, the Company
agreed to a $6 million settlement to end its longstanding legal dispute with
the U.S. Department of Agriculture over the government&#146;s award of the National
Recreation Reservation Service (NRRS) contract to ReserveAmerica, a
Ticketmaster subsidiary.&#160; The Company&#146;s
NPRS contract concluded on January 23, 2007.&#160;
The Company operated the NPRS contract for nine years; revenue
recognized was $4.0 million, $4.0 million and $3.9 million for the years ended
December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively, or 16%, 17% and 17% of total
revenue for each year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Employee Benefit Plans</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January
1, 1990, the Company established the Spherix Incorporated 401(k) Retirement
Plan.&#160; The Plan is a discretionary
defined contribution plan and covers substantially all employees who have
attained the age of 21, have completed one year of service, and have worked a
minimum of 1,000 hours in the past Plan or anniversary year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under provisions
of the Plan, the Company, for any plan year, has contributed an amount equal to
50% of the participant&#146;s contribution or 2&#189;% of the participant&#146;s eligible
compensation, whichever is less.&#160; The
Company may, at </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\fc\9210144703_D11529_1954770\5660-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 10:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">its own discretion, make
additional matching contributions to participants.&#160; Company contributions, net of forfeitures,
amounted to $122,000, $113,000, and $105,000 in 2006, 2005, and 2004,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Employee Stock Purchase Plan</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May 15, 2003, the Company approved an Employee Stock Purchase Plan
whereby the employees could purchase shares of the Company&#146;s stock.&#160; Under the Plan, the Company was authorized to
initially issue up to 500,000 shares of common stock, with additional amounts
determined annually based upon other provisions of the Plan.&#160; The Plan became available to the employees on
January 1, 2004.&#160; In 2005 and 2004, 6,985
and 1,796 shares were issued under the plan, respectively.&#160; The Board of Directors voted to discontinue
the plan effective June 30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Information by Business Segment</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating segments
are components of an enterprise about which separate financial information is
available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker, or
decision-making group, in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing
performance.&#160; The Company is managed
along two business segments, InfoSpherix and BioSpherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial information
by business segment for the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005, and 2004 is
summarized below:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.82%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.62%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.7%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006,
InfoSpherix recognized revenue from three of its customers, all of which were
government agencies, representing 16%, 15% and 11% of the total Company
revenue.&#160; During 2005, InfoSpherix
recognized revenue from four of its customers, all of which were government agencies,
representing 17%, 16%, 12% and 12% of </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\fc\9210144703_D11529_1954770\5660-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  2 10:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the total Company
revenue.&#160; During 2004, InfoSpherix
recognized revenue from three of its customers, all of which were government
agencies, representing 21%, 17%, and 13% of the total Company revenue.&#160; Government contracts accounted for
approximately 99%, 100%, and 99% of the InfoSpherix revenue in 2006, 2005, and
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">BioSpherix has
invented and patented for the Company the use of tagatose as a low-calorie
sweetener.&#160; In 1996, the Company signed
an exclusive, worldwide licensing agreement with Arla Foods Ingredients amba of
Denmark (formerly MD Foods Ingredients) for the use and sale of Spherix&#146;s
low-calorie sugar, tagatose, as a sweetener in foods and beverages (see<i>  </i>Note 10 &#147;Commitments and Contingencies&#148;).&#160; The License Agreement and an amendment
thereto provide Arla the world-wide right to manufacture and sell tagatose for
food uses, and the right to manufacture tagatose for all uses.&#160; In 2000, MDFI was merged into Arla Foods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating loss
consists of revenue less operating expenses.&#160;
In computing operating profit, interest expense and income taxes were
not considered.&#160; Operating loss for
InfoSpherix was 8% and 9% of InfoSpherix revenue for 2005 and 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Identifiable
assets by business segment are those assets used in the Company&#146;s operations in
each segment, such as accounts receivable, inventories, fixed assets, and
patent costs.&#160; Corporate assets are
principally cash and certain other assets not related to a particular segment&#146;s
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Selected Quarterly Information (in thousands, except per
share data), unaudited</font></b></p>

sets forth selected unaudited financial information for each quarter of the
last two years.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>CHANGES
IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9A.&#160; CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Disclosure
Controls and Procedures.</font></i>&nbsp; We maintain disclosure
controls and procedures that are designed to ensure that information required
to be disclosed in our Exchange Act reports, such as this report on Form 10-K,
is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods
specified in the SEC&#146;s rules and forms, and that such information is
accumulated and communicated to our management, including our Chief Executive
Officer/Chief </p>
