<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix Incorporated</font></b><br>
<b>Notes to Financial Statements</b></p>

<div align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial Officer, as
appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure. These
controls and procedures are based closely on the definition of &#147;disclosure
controls and procedures&#148; in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) promulgated under the Exchange
Act.&nbsp; Rules adopted by the SEC require that we present the conclusions of
the Chief Executive Officer/Chief Financial Officer about the effectiveness of
our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by
this annual report.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Limitations
on the Effectiveness of Controls.</font></i>&nbsp; Management, including
our Chief Executive Officer/Chief Financial Officer, do not expect that our
disclosure controls and procedures will prevent all errors and fraud.&nbsp; In
designing and evaluating the disclosure controls and procedures, management
recognized that any controls and procedures, no matter how well designed and
operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance of achieving the
desired control objectives.&nbsp; Further, the design of a control system must
reflect the fact that there are resource constraints, and management
necessarily was required to apply its judgment in evaluating the cost-benefit
relationship of possible controls and procedures.&nbsp; Because of the inherent
limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide
absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any,
within the Company have been detected.&#160;
These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in
decision-making can be faulty, and that breakdowns can occur because of simple
error or mistake.&#160; Additionally, controls
can be circumvented by the individual acts of some persons, by collusion of two
or more people, or by management&#146;s override of the control.&#160; The design of any system of controls also is
based in part upon certain assumptions about the likelihood of future events,
and there can be no assurance that any design will succeed in achieving its
stated goals under all potential future conditions.&#160; Over time, controls may become inadequate
because of changes in conditions, or the degree of compliance with the policies
or procedures may deteriorate.&#160; Because
of the inherent limitations in a cost-effective control system, misstatements
due to error or fraud may occur and not be detected.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Periodic
Evaluation and Conclusion.&nbsp;</font></i>&#160; The Company carried out an evaluation, under
the supervision and with the participation of the Company&#146;s management,
including the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer/Chief Financial Officer, of the
effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls
and procedures to provide reasonable assurance of achieving their objective
pursuant to Exchange Act Rule 13a-14. Based upon that evaluation, the Chief
Executive Officer/Chief Financial Officer concluded that the Company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures are effective at that reasonable assurance
level.&#160; There were no significant changes
in internal controls during the latest quarter over financial reporting that
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, internal
controls over financial reporting.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9B.&#160; OTHER INFORMATION</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There was no
information required to be disclosed on Form 8-K during the fourth quarter of
2006, which was not so disclosed.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="48%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:48.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Robert A. Lodder, Jr.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.74%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:33.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="48%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:48.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Robert J. Vander Zanden</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.74%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:33.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2004</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="33" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="319" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="28" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="19" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr. Douglas T. Brown, Spherix Incorporated Board Member since 2004, is
Senior Vice President and Manager of the Corporate Banking Government
Contracting Group for PNC Bank N.A., Washington, DC.&#160; Mr. Brown has been with PNC and its
predecessor bank, Riggs Bank, since 2001 and previously worked for Bank of
America, N.A. and its predecessor banks for 16 years as a Loan Officer, as well
as a manager of Loan Officers throughout the Mid-Atlantic and New England.&#160; Subsequent to 1990, the majority of Mr. Brown&#146;s
customers were companies that provided services to the Federal Government and
State governments.&#160; Mr. Brown holds a
B.A. degree in Political Science from American University and a graduate degree
from The Stonier Graduate School of Banking at the University of Delaware.&#160; He is not now, nor has he been for the past
five years, a director of a public, for-profit company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr. A. Paul Cox,
Jr. , Spherix Incorporated Board Member since 2004, brings both information
technology and general corporate management experience to Spherix.&#160; He holds a B.E.S. in Electrical Engineering
and an M.S. in Management Science, both from The Johns Hopkins University.&#160; Mr. Cox began his career designing special
purpose digital computers for the Westinghouse Underseas Division, where he
remained for seven years.&#160; Advancing
through technical assignments, he achieved increasing management responsibility
in information systems, technical services and sales promotion, serving 13
years at IBM, nine years at Data Systems Corporation, and then as Chairman and
CEO of the Codema Corporation.&#160; He was
then recruited by Standard Register as its Vice President and General
Manager.&#160; Now Principal of his own Asset
Protection Company, Mr. Cox has served on various educational, industrial,
civic and charitable boards.&#160; He is not
now, nor has he been for the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit
company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr. George C.
Creel, Spherix Incorporated Board Member since 2004, received his Bachelor of
Engineering degree in Mechanical Engineering from The Johns Hopkins University
in Baltimore, Maryland, in 1955.&#160; Except
for a brief tour on active duty in the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, he spent
his full-time working career with the Baltimore Gas and Electric Company
(BGE).&#160; There, Mr. Creel rose from Junior
Engineer to Chief Mechanical Engineer, to Executive Vice President and Acting
Chief Operating Officer until his retirement from BGE in 1997.&#160; His general management experience, including
strategic planning and focusing on performance management, brings added
strength to Spherix.&#160; He specializes in
leadership development, executive coaching, strategic planning, and performance
management.&#160; Mr. Creel serves as an
independent director for Storeroom Solutions, Inc., a privately held
corporation.&#160; He is not now, nor has he
been for the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit company other
than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dr. Gilbert V.
Levin founded Spherix Incorporated in 1967 and has been Chair, President and/or
Chief Executive Officer since incorporation.&#160;
He currently serves as Chairman of the Board and Executive Officer for
Science.&#160; Dr. Levin previously served in
the public health departments of Maryland, California, and the District of
Columbia and, subsequently, as a research scientist and corporate
official.&#160; Among his inventions are
low-caloric sweeteners; biological nutrient removal (BNR) for municipal
wastewater, rapid detection and identification of microorganisms; and the
Labeled Release life detection experiment that landed on Mars in 1976 aboard
NASA&#146;s Viking Mission.&#160; He holds a
Bachelor&#146;s, Master&#146;s, and a Ph.D., all from The Johns Hopkins University, where
he also served on its Board of Trustees and presently serves on its National
Advisory Councils for the Whiting School of Engineering.&#160; He is not now, nor has he ever been, a
director of a public company other than Spherix.&#160; Dr. Levin is the husband of Mrs. Levin and
the </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\fc\90152740355_D11854_1951285\5660-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 31 15:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">uncle of Mr. Levin.&#160; He has not worked for any company other than
Spherix since 1967, nor has he been a director of any public company other than
Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mrs. Levin served
as Spherix Incorporated&#146;s Vice President of Corporate Communications until her
retirement in January 2006.&#160; She is an
original member of the Board of Directors.&#160;
Mrs. Levin lead Spherix&#146;s public relations information efforts and
coordinated proposals for government and commercial business development.&#160; She served as Director of the Company&#146;s
Information Services Division for 25 years, while it grew into a major sector
spawning the Government and Commercial Information Divisions.&#160; Previously, Mrs. Levin was science and
medical reporter and writer for the Washington bureau of <i>Newsweek</i> magazine.&#160; She also served as writer and public
information consultant to the National Institute of Mental Health.&#160; She joined the Company in 1968, a year after
its founding.&#160; Mrs. Levin holds a B.A. in
English from Vassar College.&#160; Mrs. Levin
is the wife of Dr. Levin and the aunt of Mr. Levin.&#160; She has worked for no other company since
1968, nor has she been a director of any public company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr. Richard C.
Levin joined the Company in 1991 as Business Manager.&#160; Mr. Levin progressed through various
executive positions within the Company and served as the CFO and Vice President
for Administration during 2002.&#160; In
February 2003, Mr. Levin was promoted to the position of Interim President of
the InfoSpherix Division.&#160; In September
2004, Mr. Levin was appointed Acting CEO and President and, in February 2005
was elected CEO and President. Prior to joining Spherix, he was the General
Manager of the Catalyst Research Division of the Mine Safety Appliances
Company.&#160; Mr. Levin holds a B.S. in
business administration from the University of Baltimore and is a C.P.A. in the
State of Maryland.&#160; Mr. Levin is the
nephew of Dr. and Mrs. Levin.&#160; He was
elected to the Board of Spherix in May 2005.&#160;
Mr. Levin is not now, nor has he been for the past five years, a
director of a public company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dr. Robert A.
Lodder, Spherix Incorporated Board Member since 2005, is the Director of the
Analytical Spectroscopy Research Group of the Advanced Science and Technology
Center at the University of Kentucky.&#160; He
is currently Professor of Pharmaceutical Sciences at the College of Pharmacy,
University of Kentucky Medical Center, and holds joint appointments in the
Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, and the Division of
Analytical Chemistry of the Department of Chemistry at Kentucky.&#160; Dr. Lodder received his B.S. degree cum laude
in Natural Science and his M.S. in Chemistry in 1983 from Xavier University,
Cincinnati, Ohio in 1981.&#160; He received
his Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry in 1988 from Indiana University.&#160; He was a founder of InfraReDx, Inc. in 1998
and Prescient Medical, Inc. in 2004.&#160;
Neither of these companies are public, and they do not engage in
business with Spherix.&#160; He is not now,
nor has he been for the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit
company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dr. Robert J.
Vander Zanden, , Spherix Incorporated Board Member since 2004, having served in
two Vice President positions with Kraft Foods International, brings a long and
distinguished career in technical and business aspects of the food science
industry to Spherix.&#160; Dr. Vander Zanden
holds a Ph.D. in Food Science from Kansas State University, and an M.S. and
B.S. in Chemistry, the latter from the University of Wisconsin &#151; Platteville,
where he was named a Distinguished Alumnus in 2002.&#160; In his 30-year career, he has been with ITT
Baking Company as a Product Development Scientist, with Ralston Purina as
Manager Dietary Foods R&amp;D, with Keebler as Group Director, Product and
Process Development, with Grupo Gamesa, a Frito-Lay Company, as Vice President,
Technology, with Nabisco, as Vice President of R&amp;D for their International
Division and with the acquisition of Nabisco by Kraft Foods, he became the Vice
President of R&amp;D for Kraft&#146;s Latin American Division.&#160; Dr. Vander Zanden retired from Kraft Foods in
2004.&#160; He currently holds the title
Adjunct Professor and Lecturer, in the Department of Food Science and Human
Nutrition, where he teaches a course in New Product Development.&#160; His focus on achieving product and process
innovation through training, team building and creating positive working
environments has resulted in his being recognized with many awards for product
and packaging innovation.&#160; He is not now,
nor has he been, for the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit
company other than Spherix.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Corporate
Governance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Audit Committee members during 2006 were Mr. Brown, Chair; Mr. Cox, and Mr.
Creel.&#160; The Audit Committee Charter is
available on the Company&#146;s website at <u>www.spherix.com</u>.&#160; Each member of the Audit Committee satisfies
the independence requirements and other established criteria of the NASD and
the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160;
The Board of Directors believes that, while the members of its Audit
Committee have substantial financial and management experience and are fully
qualified to carry out the functions of the Audit Committee, none of its
members meets the requirements of an audit committee financial expert as
defined in the Securities and Exchange Commission rules.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive
Officers</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Executive
Officers of the Company are elected annually by the Board of Directors and are
listed in the following table.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Chairman, and Executive
  Officer for Science</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="36%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:36.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Richard C. Levin</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Chief Executive Officer
  and President, and Chief Financial Officer</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="36%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:36.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Jeffrey T. Lowe</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vice President,
  Corporate Communications</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="36%" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:36.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Steven M. Wade</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vice President, Information Technology, InfoSpherix</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dr. Levin&#146;s and
Richard Levin&#146;s professional experience are discussed above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.
Robert L. Clayton was elected to the Office of Director of Finance and
Treasurer in May 2005.&#160; Mr. Clayton
previously served as Controller.&#160; Prior
to joining Spherix, he was a Senior Auditor for the Public Accounting Firm
Rubino &amp; McGeehin Chartered.&#160; Mr.
Clayton holds a B.S. in business and management from the University of Maryland
and a C.P.A. from the District of Columbia.&#160;
He is not now, nor has he been for the past five years, a director of a
public, for-profit company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.
Roger A. Downs was elected to the Office of Vice President of Operations,
InfoSpherix Incorporated, in February 2005.&#160;
Mr. Downs previously served as Vice President of ReserveWorld and as
Director of Business Development and Director of the Commercial Information
Services Division, where he grew a strong health-related pharmaceutical program
for the Firm.&#160; Prior to joining Spherix,
he served as Senior Vice President-Quality Service at Standard Federal Savings
Bank in Frederick, Maryland, Vice President-Sales at Dynatech Packet Technology
in&#160; Springfield, Virginia, and Senior
Vice President-Retail Banking at Bankers Trust Company in Des Moines,
Iowa.&#160; Mr. Downs holds a M.P.A. from
Drake University School of Public Administration in Des Moines, Iowa and a B.S.
from Upper Iowa University in Fayette, Iowa. &#160;He is not now, nor has he been for the past
five years, a director of a public, for-profit company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.
Jeffrey T. Lowe was elected to the Office of Vice President of Corporate
Communications in May 2005.&#160; Mr. Lowe
previously served as Director of Communications, and prior to that (in reverse
chronological order): Director of Proposals and Publications, Proposal Manager,
and Proposal Writer.&#160; During his
employment, Mr. Lowe has been principally responsible for the production,
quality, and output of the Company&#146;s proposals, to which virtually all of the
Company&#146;s current revenue-generating contracts owe their existence.&#160; Prior to joining Spherix, Mr. Lowe had
careers as a journalist and a marine engineer.&#160;
Mr. Lowe holds a B.A. in Journalism from the University of Maryland and
a dual B.S. in Marine Engineering and Nautical Science from the United States
Merchant Marine Academy.&#160; He is not now,
nor has he been for the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.
Steven M. Wade was elected to the Office of Vice President, Information
Technology, InfoSpherix Incorporated, in May 2005.&#160; Mr. Wade previously served as Senior
Director, Information Technology.&#160; Before
joining Spherix, Mr. Wade served in senior information technology positions at
ADP; Teleglobe, a division of Bell Canada Enterprises; Verizon; and Fairchild
Space and Defense.&#160; He was born in the
United Kingdom where he obtained a BSEE in 1973 and an MBA in 1975 at Harlow
Technical College in Harlow, Essex, England. <b>&#160;</b>He is not now, nor has he been for
the past five years, a director of a public, for-profit company.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Compliance with Section 16(a) of the
Exchange Act</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Section
16(a) Beneficial Ownership Regarding Compliance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section 16(a) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), requires
the Company&#146;s Directors and Executive Officers, and anyone who beneficially
owns ten percent (10%) or more of the Company&#146;s common stock, to file with the
Securities and Exchange Commission initial reports of beneficial ownership and
reports of changes in beneficial ownership of common stock.&#160; Such persons are required by regulations of
the Securities and Exchange Commission to furnish the Company with copies of
all Section 16(a) forms they file.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based solely upon
a review of (i) copies of the Section 16(a) filings received by the Company
during or with respect to 2006 and (ii) certain written representations of its
Officers and Directors, the Company believes that each filing required to be
made pursuant to Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act during and with respect to
2006 was filed in a timely manner except for the Form 4&#146;s filed April 7, 2006,
related to stock options issued to the independent Board Members, and the Form
4&#146;s filed April 10, 2006, related to stock options issued to Executive
Officers.&#160; All of these transactions were
subsequently reported on Form 4 and all transactions are reflective in this
10-K.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Code of
Ethics</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has adopted a worldwide Code of Ethics, which is available
on the Company&#146;s website at www.spherix.com.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
11.&#160; EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Compensation
Discussion and Analysis</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Objectives of Compensation
Program and What Our Compensation Program is Designed to Reward</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our executive
compensation program is designed to create strong financial incentive for our
officers to increase revenue, profit, operating efficiency and returns, which
we expect to lead to an increase in shareholder value.&#160; The primary objective of our compensation
program is to attract and retain qualified, energetic employees who are
enthusiastic about the Company&#146;s mission.&#160;
A further objective of our compensation program is to provide incentives
and reward employees for their contribution to the Company.&#160; In addition, we strive to promote an
ownership mentality among key leadership and the Board of Directors.&#160; Finally, we endeavor to ensure that our
compensation program is perceived as fundamentally fair to all stakeholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
Committee of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Committee&#148;) evaluates both
performance and compensation to ensure that the Company maintains its ability
to attract and retain superior employees in key positions and that compensation
provided to key employees remains competitive relative to the compensation paid
to similarly situated executives of other companies.&#160; To that end, the Committee believes executive
compensation packages provided by the Company to its executives, including the
named executive officers, should include both cash and stock-based components
that reward performance as measured against established goals.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our compensation
program is designed to reward each employee&#146;s contribution to the Company.&#160; In measuring the named executive officers&#146;
contribution to the Company, the Committee considers numerous factors including
the Company&#146;s growth and financial performance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Throughout this
Form 10-K, the individual who served as the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer
and Chief Financial Officer during 2006, as well as the other individuals
included in the Summary Compensation Table on page 46, are referred to as the &#147;named
executive officers&#148;.&#160; Immediately
following this Compensation Discussion and Analysis you will find a series of
tables containing specific information about the compensation earned in 2006 by
the named executive officers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Roles and Responsibilities for
Our Compensation Program</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Role of the Compensation
Committee</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee has
responsibility for establishing, implementing and monitoring adherence with the
Company&#146;s compensation philosophy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Role of our Chief Executive
Officer</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Chief
Executive Officer provides recommendations to the Committee in its evaluation
of our executive officers, including recommendations of individual cash and
equity compensation levels for executive officers.&#160; Mr. Levin relies on his personal experience
serving in the capacity of Chief Executive Officer with respect to evaluating
the contribution of our other executive officers as well as publicly available
information for comparable compensation guidance as the basis for his recommendations
to the Committee.&#160; Mr. Levin was not
present during Committee deliberations and voting pertaining to the
determination of his own compensation.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\fc\90152740355_D11854_1951285\5660-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 31 15:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Role of the Compensation
Consultant</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee
periodically retains a consultant to provide independent advice on executive
compensation matters and to perform specific project-related work.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Elements of Company&#146;s
Compensation Plan</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
compensation program consists of base salary, an annual incentive bonus, stock
incentives/awards, health and welfare benefits and a 401(k) plan.&#160; The Company strives to be market competitive
in setting salary ranges and designing benefits programs, while recognizing the
experience and performance levels of individual employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Base Salary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
provides named executive officers and other employees with base salary to
compensate them for services rendered during the fiscal year.&#160; Base salary is the fixed annual compensation
we pay to an executive for performing specific job responsibilities.&#160; It represents the minimum income an executive
may receive in any given year.&#160; Base
salaries for named executive officers are determined for each executive based
on position and responsibility.&#160; Base
salaries for each of the Company&#146;s executives are determined by the executive&#146;s
responsibilities and performance as well as comparative compensation levels for
the executive&#146;s peers.&#160; The base salary
for the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer, including periodic changes thereto,
is determined by the Committee.&#160; The base
salaries for the Company&#146;s other executive officers, including periodic changes
thereto, are determined by the Committee following recommendations by the Chief
Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During its review
of base salaries for executives, the Committee primarily considers:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>market
data;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>internal
review of the executive&#146;s compensation, both individually and relative to other
officers;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>individual
performance of the executive;&#160; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>our
financial and operating results.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Base salary levels
are typically reviewed annually as part of the Company&#146;s performance review
process as well as upon a promotion or other change in job responsibility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Annual Bonus</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation Committee believes that a Pay-For-Performance Bonus
system must be the process to provide additional compensation for all Spherix
Executives and that this Bonus system must be based upon performance objectives
developed from the Long Range Business Plan. </font>The President and Chief
Executive Officer of Spherix, working with the Executive Staff, </font>set the performance bonus objectives.&#160; The Board&#146;s function was to review, to
recommend modifications, and to approve the objectives and the financial
bonuses associated with those objectives.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock Incentives/Awards</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We currently
administer long-term incentive compensation awards through our stock incentive
plan.&#160; We believe that widespread common
share ownership by key employees is an important means of encouraging superior
performance and employee retention.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In recent years,
this component of the Company&#146;s executive compensation program has been via the
periodic grant of stock options.&#160; The
Company generally has issued stock options to its executive officers when they
joined the Company, in connection with a significant promotion within the
Company and/or as a reward following excellent performance.&#160; The number of options granted has been based
on the level of responsibility, Company performance and individual
performance.&#160; Stock option grants have
also been structured to induce the executive to remain in the employment of the
Company by including incremental vesting provisions which permit exercise only
after satisfaction of minimum tenure requirements.&#160; Options are forfeited upon termination.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\fc\90152740355_D11854_1951285\5660-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 31 15:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Health
and Welfare Benefits</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We offer a
standard range of health and welfare benefits to all employees, including our
executive officers.&#160; These benefits
include medical, prescription drug, and dental coverages, life insurance,
accidental death and dismemberment and long-term disability insurance.&#160; Our plans do not discriminate in favor of our
executive officers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">401(k)</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We offer a defined
contribution 401(k) plan to substantially all of our employees.&#160; We provide this plan to assist our employees
in saving some amount of their cash compensation for retirement in a tax
efficient manner.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Perquisites and Personal Benefits</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not offer
any perquisites or other personal benefits to any executive with a value over
$10,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">How Compensation Amounts Are
Determined</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We strive to pay
our named executive officers at or near the median paid by comparable
companies.&#160; The Compensation Committee
hired an outside company, Equilar, Inc., to compare the total compensation of
the Spherix Executives to the total compensation of fourteen (14) companies
identified by Equilar, Inc. to be peer companies to Spherix.&#160; The Equilar Report on Executive Compensation
showed that Spherix Executives are not compensated at the same level as
colleagues in peer companies.&#160; Based upon
the fiscal health of Spherix however, it was determined by the Compensation
Committee that no special efforts should be made to bring Executive total
compensation to equivalent levels of those in peer companies.&#160; All 2007 base salary increases (with few
exceptions) should be kept in line with inflation. The Compensation Committee
requested that the President and Chief Executive Officer of Spherix propose all
Executive salary increases, but the overall Spherix company-wide increase
should not be above inflation.&#160; With
minor adjustments, these recommendations were accepted by the full Board.&#160; The Compensation Committee recommended to the
Board the salary adjustment for the President and Chief Executive Officer of
Spherix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
summary of compensation table sets forth the compensation paid by the Company
during the three years ended December 31, 2006, to all Executive Officers
earning in excess of $100,000 during any year.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">45</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\JMS\waviles\07-5660-1\task1954957\5660-1-do.htm',USER='waviles',CD='Apr  2 11:48 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Grants of Plan-Based Awards</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.28%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Name</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.42%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.18%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.52%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Grant&nbsp;Date</font></b></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.18%;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Threshold&nbsp;($&nbsp;in<br>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Narrative
Disclosure to Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan-Based Awards</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Spherix Incorporated 1997 Stock Option Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) was approved by the
Company&#146;s Stockholders on May 15, 1998.&#160;
The Plan was revised and re-approved by the Stockholders on May 12,
2005.&#160; The Plan provides for the grant of
incentive stock options and non-qualified stock options to select employees and
Directors of the Company.&#160; The Plan
provides for the issuance of up to 1,000,000 shares of Common Stock.&#160; As of December 31, 2006, there were 481,100
outstanding options granted to individuals including the above-named Executive
Officers, and 447,100 were exercisable as of such date; 403,100 options remain
available for grant at the discretion of the Board of Directors.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Awards
pursuant to the May 12, 2005 Spherix Incorporated Incentive Compensation Plan.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year-End</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
March 23, 2004, Dr. Levin&#146;s Employment Agreement was amended and restated.&#160; It provides lifetime payments of $12,500 each
quarter following his full retirement from the Company.&#160; This Restated Agreement supersedes and
replaces all previous agreements concerning Spherix&#146;s obligations for Dr. Levin&#146;s
retirement benefits.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Company agreed to fund long-term, continuous lifetime long-term care and
healthcare policies per the G.V. Levin Exit Agreement dated march 23, 2004.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
ensure the availability of their services to the Company after their respective
retirements, Dr. and Mrs. Levin each have entered into Consulting Agreements
with the Company.&#160; On March 23, 2004, the Board approved a
Restated Consulting Agreement for Dr. Levin, which limits his post-retirement
consultation to any Company requests that may be issued to him from time
to time.&#160; No minimum amount of consulting
time is required.&#160; For any consulting
time so requested and provided, Dr. Levin will be compensated at the rate of
$2,000 per day, subject to the Federal CIP, plus related expenses.&#160; On
November 16, 2005, the Board approved a Consulting Agreement for Mrs. Levin,
which limits her post-retirement consultation to any Company requests
that may be issued to her from time to time.&#160;
No minimum amount of consulting time is required.&#160; For any consulting time so requested and
provided, Mrs. Levin will be compensated at the rate of $1,000 per day, subject
to the Federal CIP, plus related expenses.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Non-Qualified Defined Contribution and Other
Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No options were exercised in 2006 by the named
Executive Officers.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='48',FILE='C:\JMS\waviles\07-5660-1\task1954957\5660-1-do.htm',USER='waviles',CD='Apr  2 11:48 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Potential Payment Upon Termination or Change in
Control</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The only
commitment we have to make any payments upon termination of employment to any
named Executive Officer is a commitment to Dr. Levin.&#160; On March 23, 2004, the Board approved revised
agreements with Dr. Levin.&#160; These
agreements provide the following post-employment benefits:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lifetime
quarterly payments of $12,500;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>$2,000
per day for any consulting services requested by the Company;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Office
space and secretarial support at the Company&#146;s headquarters and at the
BioSpherix office location for a period of three (3) years;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Free
use of his computer Internet hook-up to the Company for a period of three (3)
years;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Free
storage at the Company&#146;s headquarters of all Mars-related files for a period of
five (5) years;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lifetime
long-term care and health insurance for Dr. Levin and his wife.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unless otherwise
agreed by the Board of Directors, the other named Executive Officers would be
entitled to severance upon termination of employment pursuant to the Company&#146;s
severance policy.&#160; The policy provides:</font></p>

Officer has any commitment for payments upon a change of control of the
Company.</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
November 16, 2005, Mrs. Levin&#146;s Exit Agreement was approved by the Board.&#160; It provides lifetime payments of $12,500 each
quarter following her full retirement from the Company, which occurred on
January 4, 2006.&#160; This Exit Agreement
supersedes and replaces all previous agreements concerning Spherix&#146;s
obligations for Mrs. Levin&#146;s retirement benefits.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-employee
directors of Spherix Incorporated (&#147;Spherix&#148;) receive the following annual
compensation for service as a member of Spherix:</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='49',FILE='C:\JMS\waviles\07-5660-1\task1954957\5660-1-do.htm',USER='waviles',CD='Apr  2 11:48 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Spherix
Incorporated</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="20%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Annual Retainer</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="67%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:67.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To be paid in cash at the first meeting of the term.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="20%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.68%;">

  </td>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="67%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:67.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To be calculated by dividing $10,000 by the closing
  stock price the day the Stock Awards are granted. The shares will be granted
  upon approval of the Board; however, the shares will be restricted and
  instructions will be given to the stock transfer agent that the shares may
  not be transferred until the one year anniversary of the Board Member&#146;s
  departure from the Board.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To be paid for all teleconferences called by either

  Committee. Members must be on-line to be paid.</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="20%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.68%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="67%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:67.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To be paid to the Chairman of the Audit Committee.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"><font style="text-decoration:none;">&nbsp;</font></font></u></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Compensation
Committee Report</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
Committee of the Board of Directors oversees the compensation program of the
Company on behalf of the Board.&#160; In
fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Compensation Committee reviewed
and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis included
in this Form 10-K beginning on page 43.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
reliance on the review and discussion referred to above, the Compensation
Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation
Discussion and Analysis be included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K
for the year ended December 31, 2006, which will be filed with the SEC.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-54.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 12.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF
CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT, AND RELATED STOCKHOLDERS</b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Security
Ownership Of Certain Beneficial Owners And Management</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table sets forth the shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by all Executive
Officers and Directors as a group as of December 31, 2006.&#160; Except for Dr. Levin, Chairman of the Board
and Executive Officer for Science, and Mrs. Levin, Director and former Vice
President, no person is known by the Company to own beneficially more than 5%
of the outstanding Common Stock.&#160; The
ownership of Dr. and Mrs. Levin is detailed below.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Less
than 1% of the outstanding shares of Common Stock of the Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
1,600 shares held jointly with M. Karen Levin.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Included
in the number of shares beneficially owned by G.V. Levin, M.K. Levin, R.C.
Levin, D.T. Brown, A.P. Cox, G.C. Creel, R.J. Vander Zanden, R.A. Lodder, J.T.
Lowe, R.A. Downs, R.L. Clayton,&#160; S.M.
Wade, and All Executive Officers and Directors as a Group are 227,750, 60,000,
112,000, 7,500, 7,500, 7,500, 7,500, 5,000, 2,250, 2,000, 1,500, 500, and
436,000 shares, respectively, which such persons have a right to acquire within
60 days pursuant to stock options.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31,
2006, Dr. Levin, Chairman of the Board and Executive Officer for Science, and
Mrs. Levin, Director and former Vice President, 3180 Harness Creek Road,
Annapolis, Maryland, beneficially owned in the aggregate 2,728,457 shares of
Common Stock (19.1% of the 14,287,804 outstanding shares(1).&#160; Dr. Levin and Mrs. Levin are husband and
wife.&#160; As principal Stockholders of the
Company, they are considered control persons with respect to the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All Directors and
Executive Officers as a group, as beneficial owners of 2,934,932 shares of
Common Stock, owned 20.5% of the 14,287,804 outstanding shares</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">1</font>. With the exception of Cede
&amp; Co., the holder of record for certain brokerage firms and banks, no other
person is known by the Company to own beneficially more than 5% of the
outstanding Common Stock of the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February 2001,
the Board of Directors adopted the Rights Agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;).&#160; The Agreement provides each Stockholder of
record a dividend distribution of one &#147;right&#148; for each outstanding share of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock.&#160; Rights become
exercisable at the earlier of ten days following:&#160; (1)&nbsp;a public announcement that an
acquirer has purchased or has the right to acquire 10% or more of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock, or (2)&nbsp;the commencement of a tender offer which would result
in an offeror beneficially owning 10% or more of the outstanding Common Stock
of the Company.&#160; All rights held by an acquirer
or offeror expire on the announced acquisition date, and all rights expire at
the close of business on December 31, 2010.&#160;
Each right entitles a Stockholder to acquire, at a stated purchase
price, 1/100 of a share of the Company&#146;s preferred stock, which carries voting
and dividend rights similar to one share of its Common Stock.&#160; Alternatively, a right holder may elect to
purchase for the stated price an equivalent number of shares of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock at a price per share equal to one-half of the average market price
for a specified period.&#160; In lieu of the
stated purchase price, a right holder may elect to acquire one-half of the
Common Stock available under the second option.&#160;
The purchase price of the preferred stock fractional amount is subject
to adjustment for certain events as described in the Agreement.&#160; At the discretion of a majority of the Board
and within a specified time period, the Company may redeem all of the rights at
a price of $0.001 per right.&#160; The Board
may also amend any provisions of the Agreement prior to exercise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-54.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
13.&#160; CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED
TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
current Board of Directors consists of Mr. Douglas T. Brown, Mr. A. Paul Cox,
Jr., Mr. George C. Creel, Dr. Gilbert V. Levin, Mrs.&nbsp;M. Karen Levin, Mr.
Richard C. Levin, Dr. Robert A. Lodder, Jr., and Dr. Robert J. Vander
Zanden.&#160; The Board of Directors has
determined that a majority of its members, being Messrs. Brown, Cox, Creel,
Lodder, and Vander Zanden, are independent Directors within the meaning of the
applicable NASD rules.&#160; The Company&#146;s
Audit, Compensation, and Nominating Committees consist solely of independent
Directors.</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
475,600 shares which could be acquired pursuant to stock options or warrants
within 60 days.</p>
